result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Dolfi. km
Pre-trial conference on March 14, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

01:56 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Melstrom, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA: Bela Alexander Ballo DF ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson and Kaitlin Dippolito for today   DF:  Samuel J Perez appeared from jail. Defendant qualifies for PD.  DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. NG. Bond argument; bond ordered. Atty Dippolito states Atty Dolfi will be appointed to this case as she has represented DE in the past. Court sets PTC. DE to advise his atty if he is unable to leave treatment for next hearing. Adjourned at 1:59 PM.  gll  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
